Get a role assignment by scope and name.

Azure REST API version: 2022-04-01.




## Using getRoleAssignment {#using}

Two invocation forms are available. The direct form accepts plain
arguments and either blocks until the result value is available, or
returns a Promise-wrapped result. The output form accepts
Input-wrapped arguments and returns an Output-wrapped result.

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Id of the user who updated the assignment</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="updated_on_python">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase 'foo_storage_container'</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="condition_version_python">

        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Version of the condition. Currently the only accepted value is '2.0'</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
